title: Transition Risk Assessment
objective: Orient the learner to the 90-day framework by gauging the relevance and perceived difficulty of common transition demands; compute a Transition Risk Index and suggest focus areas.
actions: Moving to a new industry or profession
Moving to a new unit or group in the same company
Being promoted to a higher level
Leading former peers (assuming you have been promoted)
Moving from one function to another (e.g., sales to marketing)
Taking on a cross-functional leadership role for the first time
Entering a new national or ethnic culture
Having to do two jobs at the same time (finishing old role while starting new one)
Taking on a newly created role (as opposed to an existing role)
Entering an organization in which major change already is going on

buckets.label: Low
buckets.guidance: Low transitions risks. Focus on early wins, stakeholder mapping, and building organizational learning.

buckets.label: Moderate
buckets.guidance: Moderate risks. Prioritize key vulnerabilities, sequence early learning, and structure manager check-ins weekly.

buckets.label: High
buckets.guidance: High transition risks. Narrow scope, secure a sponsor early, accelerate learning, and avoid the Action Imperative trap.

next_steps: Invite learner to journal key concerns and patterns.
Recommend relevant reading from The First 90 Days.
Prompt learner to schedule a 30-minute check-in with their manager or sponsor.
Queue up the Break-Even Point visualization for conceptual reinforcement.
